job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Staff is helpful and friendly
cons: None that I have seen

pros: The school wants to put you and your professional development first. You can enroll in CCE courses for free, which can cost upwards to $2,500 depending on the class. They also have a great family like culture.
cons: Leadership is very much stuck in the late 90s/early 2000s. They aren't looking forward like other technical schools are.

pros: Wonderful experience getting to meet so many people. Helping Staff
cons: Once a month pay wasn't the best.

job_title: Experienced Lead Academic Advisor in Columbia, SC
pros: Good hours and great people work here. Can be hectic during peak times but teamwork helps!
cons: Siloed departments but I believe that is being worked on. Technical issues at times. Not really with the "work from home" idea but that may be changing with the current state of things.

review_title: A Great Way to Start Your Career Journey
pros: I love my job. I receive State benefits although part- time, and I have the opportunity to work in a positive environment with people that love what they do! Also, there are many opportunities to advance.
cons: In my position, I don't have any.

job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Columbia, SC
pros: Nice place to work and fellow staff and faculty are very friendly.
cons: Salary is not as high as 4 year colleges.

pros: Coworkers, students, mission, flexibility, location
cons: Top down leadership, behind the times, salary

review_title: Good with a few bad apples
pros: Great work environment, good pay and benefits. Nice campus with serious Covid protocols. Great communication.
cons: Leadership needs a reorganization but nothing major. Probably no more than any other college in the area.

pros: Pay was comparable to any other colleges, benefits were good.
cons: My direct boss was awful to me, she actually ran my replacement off in just a few months. Formal complaints were filed against her but they didn't go anywhere.

pros: Learn how to work with diverse population and how to multitask
cons: Not many opportunities for upward mobility or salary increases

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Lexington, SC
pros: Managers want to see you succeed.
cons: Lower salaries than private sector

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Columbia, SC
pros: Very flexible to work and the people there make it enjoyable! It feels like a family while working there. Everyone is ready to help each-other.
cons: There are no benefits (ex. Medical, Dental, or Vision), retirement is optional but confusing and HR may accidentally enroll you into it. Work is very easy but can be repetitive and not challenging most of the time.

review_title: You can get anywhere from here
job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Lexington, SC
pros:
Work schedule: off at 1:30 on Fridays 
Assisting students with life changing opportunities 
Graduation 
Networking events
cons:
Lack of opportunities to grow professionally 
Top heavy management

job_title: Student Services Program Coordinator II in Columbia, SC
pros: Benefits, community, making a difference, colleagues.
cons: Bureaucratic, minimal promotion ability, difficult to negotiate new salary

job_title: Computer and Information Systems Manager II in Columbia, SC
pros: State Employee, State Benefits, State Retirement
cons: Low Pay, Stagnation, No Promotions

pros: They truly appreciate students and encourage employees to help students.
cons: management/departments in constant conflict with upper level mgt desires

pros: Coworkers and students and campus
cons: Pay, workload, atmosphere, respect, flexibility

pros: Diverse 2-yr. college that offers great opportunities for someone who is looking to get involved in higher education leadership.
cons: None that I can think of at the moment.

pros: Very friendly atmosphere that focuses on making sure we take care of the students.
cons: Leadership has a tendency to dislike change. " We have always done it this way" mentality which can be frustrating.

pros: Moved to Guided Pathways model; realigned courses to make more sense for future careers.
cons: Silos between Academics and Student Services.

review_title: Nice place to work with friendly co-workers and purposeful mission.Very pleasant but hard working and dedicated people
job_title: Internal Auditor in West Columbia, SC
pros: People, family atmosphere, challenge & they care about you. Talented hires make a great team of committed workforce and fine leadership that is in touch with what is going on. There is no greater mission than education especially in these challenging times
cons: Big college so have to stay up on changes. Large business with several campuses make communication a challenge

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Columbia, SC
pros: Good co-workers mostly.  The students are wonderful and mostly eager to learn.
cons: Micromanagers.  The full time faculty look down on adjuncts and always act like someone is after their job.  The have started hiring people that do not know the material they are teaching and teach many things incorrectly.  Pay is very low.  Department chair is running off all of the talented, knowledgable faculty.  The will not hire full time from their formerly talented adjust faculty pool.

review_title: Good Office but Overall Business Model needs work
pros:
Each individual office (Admissions, Financial Aid, etc) has a lot to offer.
Pay is competitive, higher than a 4 year university
Benefits are basic State Employee
Office is fairly new
cons:
The direction of the school needs to be refreshed
Directors and Vice Presidents are out of touch with employees and students
Things that need to change get stuck in purgatory

pros: steady work, you can work anywhere they need you if you want the hours.
cons: no benefits though, no time and a half, no overtime, no holiday, no paid vacation, no paid sick leave.

pros: Great people to work with, everyone is rowing in the same direction. Caring, compassionate and passionate people helping students "get anywhere from here".
cons: If there were any it would be the holiday schedule.

pros: Great place to work good employees good office atmosphere
cons: Pay is not comparable to skills Or education

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Columbia, SC
pros: Helping student throughout their educational career.
cons: Too many politics and not much room for advancement if you are not formed in the cliques of the "higher-ups".

pros: Fabulous  atmosphere  and a nurturing  environment.
cons: Very little opportunity for full-time  employment  as an instructor.

pros:
Flexible schedule
Positive support system

pros: Really good people and awesome students.
cons: You have to know someone on the inside to move from contract to permanent.

pros: Great company and wonderful environment. Loved it.
